meanings.sent1: The blacksmith anvilled the hot metal into a horseshoe.
meanings.sent2: The craftsman anvilled the metal sheet into a beautiful sculpture.
meanings.sent3: The apprentice accidentally anvilled his thumb instead of the metal.
meanings.sent4: She anvilled her thoughts into a coherent plan for the project.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of anvilled metal echoed through the workshop.

meanings.sent1: The blacksmith anvilled the red-hot iron to shape it perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The hammer anvilled the metal piece with precision.
meanings.sent3: The musician anvilled the keys of the piano with passion.
meanings.sent4: The rain anvilled against the roof, creating a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor anvilled the chisel to create intricate details.

meanings.definition: Having the shape of an anvil.
meanings.sent1: The cloud resembled an anvilled shape in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The rock had an anvilled appearance with its flat top.
meanings.sent3: The cake was decorated in an anvilled design for the blacksmith's birthday.
meanings.sent4: The building had an anvilled roof that stood out in the cityscape.
meanings.sent5: The tree stump had an anvilled look due to years of weathering.
